page.title: 05Ticehurst School - Past
page.content: Ticehurst school has changed since the 1930's. It used to have outside toilets and children attended between the ages of five and fourteen. The playground was split by a wall to separate the boys and girls but they shared classrooms. When starting school they used blackboard and chalks later they had pencils and then pens. Most girls wore a gymslip with blouse or jumper, dark stockings with lace up shoes in winter, sandals and white ankle socks in summer. The boys wore short trousers until they left school. Sunday best clothes were usually for Sunday school. The schooling was very strict. When naughty, boys were caned on the bottom and girls on hand. There were about 40 in each class and six classes. The head was a full time teacher as well. Most of the children walked to school.
